qas.question: What is the name of the Marshall Islands in its native language?
Near what major line of latitutde are the Marshall Islands located?
As of 2011, how many people live in the Marshall Islands?
What country borders the Marshall Islands on the western side?
Which island is home to the capital of the Marshall Islands?
What is the official name of the Marshall Islands?
In what ocean are the Marshall Islands located?
How many people lived in the Marshall Islands in 2011?
How many coral atolls comprise the Marshall Islands?
On what island is the capital of the Marshall Islands?

context: The Marshall Islands, officially the <a5_0>Republic of the Marshall Islands<a5_0/> (Marshallese: <a0_0>Aolepān Aorōkin M̧ajeļ<a0_0/>),[note 1] is an island country located near <a1_0>the equator<a1_0/> in the <a6_0>Pacific Ocean<a6_0/>, slightly west of the International Date Line. Geographically, the country is part of the larger island group of Micronesia. The country's population of <a2_0><a7_0>53,158<a7_0/><a2_0/> people (at the 2011 Census) is spread out over <a8_0>29<a8_0/> coral atolls, comprising 1,156 individual islands and islets. The islands share maritime boundaries with <a3_0>the Federated States of Micronesia<a3_0/> to the west, Wake Island to the north,[note 2] Kiribati to the south-east, and Nauru to the south. About 27,797 of the islanders (at the 2011 Census) live on <a4_0><a9_0>Majuro<a9_0/><a4_0/>, which contains the capital.
